items.content_html: Hello from macOS Mojave!

I played around with a long shutter on my camera to shoot some fireworks tonight. I‚Äôm pretty happy with some of the results.

Happy 4th of July!
It‚Äôs impressive that this school can disable fire on its property.
I‚Äôm taking the citizen survey for my city and realizing how bad of a job I do of knowing what goes on in our city government and local community.
The thing I love about doing the taphouse.io project is that it will help me get my blog running using Maverick. I needed to get TLS working to enable the APIs for Micropub and XML-RPC.
And just like that taphouse.io is backed by letsprotect in Docker. Think it‚Äôs worth writing up how I added TLS to an nginx Docker container?

I‚Äôm incredibly excited to get my hands on the Dwell audio Bible. Their samples that have posted are amazing. I‚Äôve been wanting a non-cheesy, well spoken Bible for a while now. Check it out to save 30% if you pre-order!
Seahawks training camp tickets acquired! That was surprisingly easy. Looking forward to the VMAC berm on 7/27!
New post from jsorge.net: Proxying Vapor 3 Using nginx and Docker
I‚Äôm trying once again to get TLS working on nginx in Docker with letsencrypt. I think I might have found the right blog post to help me get it done.
The last piece of this nginx container is to get SSL working. I want to use acme.sh but can‚Äôt figure out how to get it spun up using docker-compose. Any ideas?

Achievement unlocked: taphouse.io is now being fully served by Docker. The Vapor community is so helpful, especially @bygri.

I‚Äôll try to get a full writeup done soon. This is going to help me get Maverick off the ground on a server.
New post from jsorge.net: Building a Blog Engine
Is there any way to direct the deployment target of the Swift Package Manager‚Äôs Xcode project generation function? It insists on making my project with 10.10 as the target but I want 10.12.

Touched down in San Francisco. I‚Äôm here just for a couple of days for work, heading home on Tuesday evening.

Miss my family already.
Hold on to your butts.

I just got an incredibly convincing spam email from the ‚ÄúApp Store‚Äù confirming my subscription to YouTube Red (which I don‚Äôt subscribe to). This is your reminder to be very critical of messages that look official!

As one who doesn‚Äôt really know much about algorithms, the WWDC session on them was quite insightful into how they could be used to refactor ‚Äúpractical‚Äù code. I‚Äôll have to come back to this one.

Holy crap. I‚Äôve got got micropub publishing working on Maverick. Still need to figure out images but I‚Äôm super happy with how things are shaping up.

üéâ

Did Xcode 9.4 totally change how debugging app extensions works? I used to be able to run an extension target and it would ask what host to attach to. Now it says that it can‚Äôt install the target because the target is not an application.

How cool would it be if Marzipan comes as part of iOS 12.3 in the spring instead of iOS 13? I mean, there‚Äôs no way that could be their big reveal at next year‚Äôs WWDC, right?

I would love to see them go on a Marizpan roadshow in the spring.
Thanks Xcode. I didn‚Äôt actually want to run this app on my phone. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
I‚Äôm so tempted to install iOS 12 Beta 1. I keep hearing how great it is already.

I got RSS feeds being created in Maverick! I still need to automate their generation when a new post is dropped into the posts folder (I probably need to learn about Vapor workers) but I‚Äôm happy to have output being generated.
I think the WWDC State of the Union this afternoon is going to be absolutely amazing.
